intro: Eusteralis linearis, commonly known as the slender eusteralis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of grass species. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
